    <mr-cue centered="" cueprefname="search_for_numbers" hidden=""></mr-cue>


          
      
        mr-issue-page {
          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;
          --mr-toggled-font-family: inherit;
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-open-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          width: 24em;
          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          z-index: 100;
        }
        .issue-header-container {
          z-index: 10;
          position: sticky;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-bottom: 0.25em;
          width: 100%;
        }
        mr-issue-details {
          min-width: 50%;
          max-width: 1000px;
          flex-grow: 1;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
        }
        mr-issue-metadata {
          position: sticky;
          overflow-y: auto;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          height: calc(100vh - var(--monorail-header-height));
        }
        mr-launch-overview {
          border-left: var(--chops-normal-border);
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          width: 50%;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
        }
        @media (max-width: 1126px) {
          .container-issue-content {
            flex-direction: column;
            padding: 0 var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          }
          mr-issue-details, mr-launch-overview {
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
        }
        @media (max-width: 840px) {
          .container-outside {
            flex-direction: column;
          }
          .metadata-container {
            width: 100%;
            height: auto;
            border: 0;
            border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          }
          mr-issue-metadata {
            min-width: auto;
            max-width: auto;
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            min-height: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
          mr-issue-metadata, .issue-header-container {
            position: static;
          }
        }

        Email display settings<h2>Email display settings</h2>

        There is a setting<a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.<p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.<p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to get
        involved<a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.<p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="privacyDialog" forced="">
        <h2>Email display settings</h2>

        <p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        <p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        <p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

      
      
        
          <slot></slot>
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      <dialog class="dialog" role="dialog">
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      </dialog>
    
        This site hosts public issues in public projects<h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.<p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.<p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>

          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="corpModeDialog" forced="">
        <h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        <p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        <p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

      The reason is the same as <span class="line"><!---->The reason is the same as <!----></span>Issue 1308305<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1308305" title="Security: heap-use-after-free in component_updater::ClientSidePhishingComponentInstallerPolicy::~ClientSidePhishingComponentInstallerPolicy"><!---->Issue 1308305<!----></a>, <span class="line"><!---->, <!----></span>1308305<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1308305" title="Security: heap-use-after-free in component_updater::ClientSidePhishingComponentInstallerPolicy::~ClientSidePhishingComponentInstallerPolicy"><!---->1308305<!----></a> <span class="line"><!----> <!----></span>has been fixed, but I found that there is still a problem with this code.<span class="line"><!---->has been fixed, but I found that there is still a problem with this code.<!----></span><br><br>-----------------------<span class="line"><!---->-----------------------<!----></span><br>class SwReporterOnDemandFetcher : public ServiceObserver {<span class="line"><!---->class SwReporterOnDemandFetcher : public ServiceObserver {<!----></span><br><br>-------------------------<b class="line"><!---->-------------------------<!----></b>---<span class="line"><!---->---<!----></span><br><br>using ServiceObserver = ComponentUpdateService::Observer;<span class="line"><!---->using ServiceObserver = ComponentUpdateService::Observer;<!----></span><br><br><br>----------------------<span class="line"><!---->----------------------<!----></span><br><br>SwReporterOnDemandFetcher::~SwReporterOnDemandFetcher() {<span class="line"><!---->SwReporterOnDemandFetcher::~SwReporterOnDemandFetcher() {<!----></span><br>   cus_->RemoveObserver(this);  // UAF here <span class="line"><!---->   cus_-&gt;RemoveObserver(this);  // UAF here <!----></span><br>}<span class="line"><!---->}<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        I think the ComponentUpdateService outlives SwReporterOnDemandFetcher. See <span class="line"><!---->I think the ComponentUpdateService outlives SwReporterOnDemandFetcher. See <!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:chrome/browser/component_updater/sw_reporter_installer_win.h;drc=0e45c020c43b1a9f6d2870ff7f92b30a2f03a458;l=106<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:chrome/browser/component_updater/sw_reporter_installer_win.h;drc=0e45c020c43b1a9f6d2870ff7f92b30a2f03a458;l=106"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:chrome/browser/component_updater/sw_reporter_installer_win.h;drc=0e45c020c43b1a9f6d2870ff7f92b30a2f03a458;l=106<!----></a>.<span class="line"><!---->.<!----></span> <span class="line"><!----> <!----></span><br><br>CCing sorin@, waffles@ on this for confirmation.<span class="line"><!---->CCing sorin@, waffles@ on this for confirmation.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        CUS is destroyed postthreadstop during browser shutdown.<span class="line"><!---->CUS is destroyed postthreadstop during browser shutdown.<!----></span><br>It looks like the SwReporterOnDemandFetcher destructor runs on each call to RequestUserInitiatedScan (which I don't think can happen post thread stop) or on destruction of ChromeCleanerControllerImpl (which I think never happens outside of tests).<span class="line"><!---->It looks like the SwReporterOnDemandFetcher destructor runs on each call to RequestUserInitiatedScan (which I don't think can happen post thread stop) or on destruction of ChromeCleanerControllerImpl (which I think never happens outside of tests).<!----></span><br><br>Joe, is that right?<span class="line"><!---->Joe, is that right?<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        by

          Components:<strong><!---->Components:</strong>
          
          Services>Safebrowsing>ChromeCleanup
          
          <br>
        
        
      <div class="issue-diff">
        <!---->
          <strong><!---->Components:</strong>
          
          Services&gt;Safebrowsing&gt;ChromeCleanup
          
          <br>
        <!---->
        
      </div><br>
    
        
      
        You can create a SwReporterOnDemandFetcher by going to chrome://settings/cleanup and clicking the "Find" button. (Requires a Google branded Chrome build.) I believe it's NOT created if the component updater happens to already by downloading a copy of the SwReporter component.<span class="line"><!---->You can create a SwReporterOnDemandFetcher by going to chrome://settings/cleanup and clicking the "Find" button. (Requires a Google branded Chrome build.) I believe it's NOT created if the component updater happens to already by downloading a copy of the SwReporter component.<!----></span><br><br>So this should only happen if UI is displayed. Possibly it could be triggered at an odd time by automation (eg. selenium). Untrusted web pages and extensions shouldn't be able to interact with chrome://settings so I think this would be low security impact.<span class="line"><!---->So this should only happen if UI is displayed. Possibly it could be triggered at an odd time by automation (eg. selenium). Untrusted web pages and extensions shouldn't be able to interact with chrome://settings so I think this would be low security impact.<!----></span><br><br>I'm not sure how the lifetime of ComponentUpdater interacts with this, but I hope that's enough to point the investigation.<span class="line"><!---->I'm not sure how the lifetime of ComponentUpdater interacts with this, but I hope that's enough to point the investigation.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

           issue<h3 class="medium-heading"><!----> issue</h3>
          
            Target project:<label for="targetProjectInput">Target project:</label>
            
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              
      
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }

      <style>
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }

          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;
          --mr-toggled-font-family: inherit;

        }
        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {

          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }

        Email display settings<h2>Email display settings</h2>

        There is a setting<a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.<p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.<p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to get
        involved<a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.<p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="privacyDialog" forced="">
        <h2>Email display settings</h2>

        <p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        <p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        <p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

      
      
        
          <slot></slot>
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      <dialog class="dialog" role="dialog">
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      </dialog>
    
        This site hosts public issues in public projects<h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.<p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.<p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="corpModeDialog" forced="">
        <h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        <p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        <p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>

        CUS is destroyed postthreadstop during browser shutdown.<span class="line"><!---->CUS is destroyed postthreadstop during browser shutdown.<!----></span><br>It looks like the SwReporterOnDemandFetcher destructor runs on each call to RequestUserInitiatedScan (which I don't think can happen post thread stop) or on destruction of ChromeCleanerControllerImpl (which I think never happens outside of tests).<span class="line"><!---->It looks like the SwReporterOnDemandFetcher destructor runs on each call to RequestUserInitiatedScan (which I don't think can happen post thread stop) or on destruction of ChromeCleanerControllerImpl (which I think never happens outside of tests).<!----></span><br><br>Joe, is that right?<span class="line"><!---->Joe, is that right?<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on

          Components:<strong><!---->Components:</strong>
          
          Services>Safebrowsing>ChromeCleanup
          
          <br>
        
        
      <div class="issue-diff">
        <!---->
          <strong><!---->Components:</strong>
          
          Services&gt;Safebrowsing&gt;ChromeCleanup
          
          <br>
        <!---->
        
      </div><br>
    
        
      
        You can create a SwReporterOnDemandFetcher by going to chrome://settings/cleanup and clicking the "Find" button. (Requires a Google branded Chrome build.) I believe it's NOT created if the component updater happens to already by downloading a copy of the SwReporter component.<span class="line"><!---->You can create a SwReporterOnDemandFetcher by going to chrome://settings/cleanup and clicking the "Find" button. (Requires a Google branded Chrome build.) I believe it's NOT created if the component updater happens to already by downloading a copy of the SwReporter component.<!----></span><br><br>So this should only happen if UI is displayed. Possibly it could be triggered at an odd time by automation (eg. selenium). Untrusted web pages and extensions shouldn't be able to interact with chrome://settings so I think this would be low security impact.<span class="line"><!---->So this should only happen if UI is displayed. Possibly it could be triggered at an odd time by automation (eg. selenium). Untrusted web pages and extensions shouldn't be able to interact with chrome://settings so I think this would be low security impact.<!----></span><br><br>I'm not sure how the lifetime of ComponentUpdater interacts with this, but I hope that's enough to point the investigation.<span class="line"><!---->I'm not sure how the lifetime of ComponentUpdater interacts with this, but I hope that's enough to point the investigation.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        </div>

           issue<h3 class="medium-heading"><!----> issue</h3>
          
            Target project:<label for="targetProjectInput">Target project:</label>
            
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              
      
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }

    <mr-autocomplete vocabularyname="project" for="targetProjectInput" role="listbox" id="chops-autocomplete-1"><!---->
      <style>
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }
      </style>

         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM

          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;

        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {

            <textarea id="commentContent" placeholder="Add a comment"></textarea>

       Note: Avoiding 2-way data binding to futureproof this code
        for LitElement. 
      <input id="checkbox" type="checkbox">
      
        <slot></slot>
      <label for="checkbox">
        <slot></slot>
      </label>

        Email display settings<h2>Email display settings</h2>

        There is a setting<a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.<p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.<p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to get
        involved<a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.<p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="privacyDialog" forced="">
        <h2>Email display settings</h2>

        <p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        <p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        <p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

      
      
        
          <slot></slot>
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      <dialog class="dialog" role="dialog">
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      </dialog>
    
        This site hosts public issues in public projects<h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.<p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.<p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="corpModeDialog" forced="">
        <h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        <p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        <p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>

      The reason is the same as <span class="line"><!---->The reason is the same as <!----></span>Issue 1308305<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1308305" title="Security: heap-use-after-free in component_updater::ClientSidePhishingComponentInstallerPolicy::~ClientSidePhishingComponentInstallerPolicy"><!---->Issue 1308305<!----></a>, <span class="line"><!---->, <!----></span>1308305<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1308305" title="Security: heap-use-after-free in component_updater::ClientSidePhishingComponentInstallerPolicy::~ClientSidePhishingComponentInstallerPolicy"><!---->1308305<!----></a> <span class="line"><!----> <!----></span>has been fixed, but I found that there is still a problem with this code.<span class="line"><!---->has been fixed, but I found that there is still a problem with this code.<!----></span><br><br>-----------------------<span class="line"><!---->-----------------------<!----></span><br>class SwReporterOnDemandFetcher : public ServiceObserver {<span class="line"><!---->class SwReporterOnDemandFetcher : public ServiceObserver {<!----></span><br><br>-------------------------<b class="line"><!---->-------------------------<!----></b>---<span class="line"><!---->---<!----></span><br><br>using ServiceObserver = ComponentUpdateService::Observer;<span class="line"><!---->using ServiceObserver = ComponentUpdateService::Observer;<!----></span><br><br><br>----------------------<span class="line"><!---->----------------------<!----></span><br><br>SwReporterOnDemandFetcher::~SwReporterOnDemandFetcher() {<span class="line"><!---->SwReporterOnDemandFetcher::~SwReporterOnDemandFetcher() {<!----></span><br>   cus_->RemoveObserver(this);  // UAF here <span class="line"><!---->   cus_-&gt;RemoveObserver(this);  // UAF here <!----></span><br>}<span class="line"><!---->}<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

          Components:<strong><!---->Components:</strong>
          
          Services>Safebrowsing>ChromeCleanup
          
          <br>
        
        
      <div class="issue-diff">
        <!---->
          <strong><!---->Components:</strong>
          
          Services&gt;Safebrowsing&gt;ChromeCleanup
          
          <br>
        <!---->
        
      </div><br>
    
        
      
        You can create a SwReporterOnDemandFetcher by going to chrome://settings/cleanup and clicking the "Find" button. (Requires a Google branded Chrome build.) I believe it's NOT created if the component updater happens to already by downloading a copy of the SwReporter component.<span class="line"><!---->You can create a SwReporterOnDemandFetcher by going to chrome://settings/cleanup and clicking the "Find" button. (Requires a Google branded Chrome build.) I believe it's NOT created if the component updater happens to already by downloading a copy of the SwReporter component.<!----></span><br><br>So this should only happen if UI is displayed. Possibly it could be triggered at an odd time by automation (eg. selenium). Untrusted web pages and extensions shouldn't be able to interact with chrome://settings so I think this would be low security impact.<span class="line"><!---->So this should only happen if UI is displayed. Possibly it could be triggered at an odd time by automation (eg. selenium). Untrusted web pages and extensions shouldn't be able to interact with chrome://settings so I think this would be low security impact.<!----></span><br><br>I'm not sure how the lifetime of ComponentUpdater interacts with this, but I hope that's enough to point the investigation.<span class="line"><!---->I'm not sure how the lifetime of ComponentUpdater interacts with this, but I hope that's enough to point the investigation.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

            Issue 1308953: Security: heap-use-after-free in SwReporterOnDemandFetcher::~SwReporterOnDemandFetcher
          <h1>
            
            Issue 1308953: Security: heap-use-after-free in SwReporterOnDemandFetcher::~SwReporterOnDemandFetcher
          </h1>
          
            Reported by
            
      <link href="https://fonts.googleapis.com/icon?family=Material+Icons" rel="stylesheet">
      schedule<i id="availability-icon" class="material-icons inline-icon ${user.last_visit_timestamp ? '': 'inline-icon-unseen'}" title="undefined" hidden="">schedule</i>
      hacky...@gmail.com<a id="user-link" href="/u/1989746692" title="hacky...@gmail.com"><!---->hacky...@gmail.com<!----></a>
      hacky...@gmail.com<span id="user-text" hidden=""><!---->hacky...@gmail.com<!----></span>
      <div id="availability-text" class="availability-notice" title="undefined" hidden=""><!----><!----></div>
    <mr-user-link aria-label="issue reporter"></mr-user-link>
            on 
      Mon, Mar 21, 2022, 9:47 PM EDT

      The reason is the same as <span class="line"><!---->The reason is the same as <!----></span>Issue 1308305<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1308305" title="Security: heap-use-after-free in component_updater::ClientSidePhishingComponentInstallerPolicy::~ClientSidePhishingComponentInstallerPolicy"><!---->Issue 1308305<!----></a>, <span class="line"><!---->, <!----></span>1308305<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1308305" title="Security: heap-use-after-free in component_updater::ClientSidePhishingComponentInstallerPolicy::~ClientSidePhishingComponentInstallerPolicy"><!---->1308305<!----></a> <span class="line"><!----> <!----></span>has been fixed, but I found that there is still a problem with this code.<span class="line"><!---->has been fixed, but I found that there is still a problem with this code.<!----></span><br><br>-----------------------<span class="line"><!---->-----------------------<!----></span><br>class SwReporterOnDemandFetcher : public ServiceObserver {<span class="line"><!---->class SwReporterOnDemandFetcher : public ServiceObserver {<!----></span><br><br>-------------------------<b class="line"><!---->-------------------------<!----></b>---<span class="line"><!---->---<!----></span><br><br>using ServiceObserver = ComponentUpdateService::Observer;<span class="line"><!---->using ServiceObserver = ComponentUpdateService::Observer;<!----></span><br><br><br>----------------------<span class="line"><!---->----------------------<!----></span><br><br>SwReporterOnDemandFetcher::~SwReporterOnDemandFetcher() {<span class="line"><!---->SwReporterOnDemandFetcher::~SwReporterOnDemandFetcher() {<!----></span><br>   cus_->RemoveObserver(this);  // UAF here <span class="line"><!---->   cus_-&gt;RemoveObserver(this);  // UAF here <!----></span><br>}<span class="line"><!---->}<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        CUS is destroyed postthreadstop during browser shutdown.<span class="line"><!---->CUS is destroyed postthreadstop during browser shutdown.<!----></span><br>It looks like the SwReporterOnDemandFetcher destructor runs on each call to RequestUserInitiatedScan (which I don't think can happen post thread stop) or on destruction of ChromeCleanerControllerImpl (which I think never happens outside of tests).<span class="line"><!---->It looks like the SwReporterOnDemandFetcher destructor runs on each call to RequestUserInitiatedScan (which I don't think can happen post thread stop) or on destruction of ChromeCleanerControllerImpl (which I think never happens outside of tests).<!----></span><br><br>Joe, is that right?<span class="line"><!---->Joe, is that right?<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        by

          Components:<strong><!---->Components:</strong>
          
          Services>Safebrowsing>ChromeCleanup
          
          <br>
        
        
      <div class="issue-diff">
        <!---->
          <strong><!---->Components:</strong>
          
          Services&gt;Safebrowsing&gt;ChromeCleanup
          
          <br>
        <!---->
        
      </div><br>
    
        
      
        You can create a SwReporterOnDemandFetcher by going to chrome://settings/cleanup and clicking the "Find" button. (Requires a Google branded Chrome build.) I believe it's NOT created if the component updater happens to already by downloading a copy of the SwReporter component.<span class="line"><!---->You can create a SwReporterOnDemandFetcher by going to chrome://settings/cleanup and clicking the "Find" button. (Requires a Google branded Chrome build.) I believe it's NOT created if the component updater happens to already by downloading a copy of the SwReporter component.<!----></span><br><br>So this should only happen if UI is displayed. Possibly it could be triggered at an odd time by automation (eg. selenium). Untrusted web pages and extensions shouldn't be able to interact with chrome://settings so I think this would be low security impact.<span class="line"><!---->So this should only happen if UI is displayed. Possibly it could be triggered at an odd time by automation (eg. selenium). Untrusted web pages and extensions shouldn't be able to interact with chrome://settings so I think this would be low security impact.<!----></span><br><br>I'm not sure how the lifetime of ComponentUpdater interacts with this, but I hope that's enough to point the investigation.<span class="line"><!---->I'm not sure how the lifetime of ComponentUpdater interacts with this, but I hope that's enough to point the investigation.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>

        CUS is destroyed postthreadstop during browser shutdown.<span class="line"><!---->CUS is destroyed postthreadstop during browser shutdown.<!----></span><br>It looks like the SwReporterOnDemandFetcher destructor runs on each call to RequestUserInitiatedScan (which I don't think can happen post thread stop) or on destruction of ChromeCleanerControllerImpl (which I think never happens outside of tests).<span class="line"><!---->It looks like the SwReporterOnDemandFetcher destructor runs on each call to RequestUserInitiatedScan (which I don't think can happen post thread stop) or on destruction of ChromeCleanerControllerImpl (which I think never happens outside of tests).<!----></span><br><br>Joe, is that right?<span class="line"><!---->Joe, is that right?<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        <chops-timestamp title="Wed, Mar 23, 2022, 5:10 PM EDT"></chops-timestamp>

          Components:<strong><!---->Components:</strong>
          
          Services>Safebrowsing>ChromeCleanup
          
          <br>
        
        
      <div class="issue-diff">
        <!---->
          <strong><!---->Components:</strong>
          
          Services&gt;Safebrowsing&gt;ChromeCleanup
          
          <br>
        <!---->
        
      </div><br>
    
        
      
        You can create a SwReporterOnDemandFetcher by going to chrome://settings/cleanup and clicking the "Find" button. (Requires a Google branded Chrome build.) I believe it's NOT created if the component updater happens to already by downloading a copy of the SwReporter component.<span class="line"><!---->You can create a SwReporterOnDemandFetcher by going to chrome://settings/cleanup and clicking the "Find" button. (Requires a Google branded Chrome build.) I believe it's NOT created if the component updater happens to already by downloading a copy of the SwReporter component.<!----></span><br><br>So this should only happen if UI is displayed. Possibly it could be triggered at an odd time by automation (eg. selenium). Untrusted web pages and extensions shouldn't be able to interact with chrome://settings so I think this would be low security impact.<span class="line"><!---->So this should only happen if UI is displayed. Possibly it could be triggered at an odd time by automation (eg. selenium). Untrusted web pages and extensions shouldn't be able to interact with chrome://settings so I think this would be low security impact.<!----></span><br><br>I'm not sure how the lifetime of ComponentUpdater interacts with this, but I hope that's enough to point the investigation.<span class="line"><!---->I'm not sure how the lifetime of ComponentUpdater interacts with this, but I hope that's enough to point the investigation.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>

        CUS is destroyed postthreadstop during browser shutdown.<span class="line"><!---->CUS is destroyed postthreadstop during browser shutdown.<!----></span><br>It looks like the SwReporterOnDemandFetcher destructor runs on each call to RequestUserInitiatedScan (which I don't think can happen post thread stop) or on destruction of ChromeCleanerControllerImpl (which I think never happens outside of tests).<span class="line"><!---->It looks like the SwReporterOnDemandFetcher destructor runs on each call to RequestUserInitiatedScan (which I don't think can happen post thread stop) or on destruction of ChromeCleanerControllerImpl (which I think never happens outside of tests).<!----></span><br><br>Joe, is that right?<span class="line"><!---->Joe, is that right?<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        <chops-timestamp title="Wed, Mar 23, 2022, 5:10 PM EDT"></chops-timestamp>

          Components:<strong><!---->Components:</strong>
          
          Services>Safebrowsing>ChromeCleanup
          
          <br>
        
        
      <div class="issue-diff">
        <!---->
          <strong><!---->Components:</strong>
          
          Services&gt;Safebrowsing&gt;ChromeCleanup
          
          <br>
        <!---->
        
      </div><br>
    
        
      
        You can create a SwReporterOnDemandFetcher by going to chrome://settings/cleanup and clicking the "Find" button. (Requires a Google branded Chrome build.) I believe it's NOT created if the component updater happens to already by downloading a copy of the SwReporter component.<span class="line"><!---->You can create a SwReporterOnDemandFetcher by going to chrome://settings/cleanup and clicking the "Find" button. (Requires a Google branded Chrome build.) I believe it's NOT created if the component updater happens to already by downloading a copy of the SwReporter component.<!----></span><br><br>So this should only happen if UI is displayed. Possibly it could be triggered at an odd time by automation (eg. selenium). Untrusted web pages and extensions shouldn't be able to interact with chrome://settings so I think this would be low security impact.<span class="line"><!---->So this should only happen if UI is displayed. Possibly it could be triggered at an odd time by automation (eg. selenium). Untrusted web pages and extensions shouldn't be able to interact with chrome://settings so I think this would be low security impact.<!----></span><br><br>I'm not sure how the lifetime of ComponentUpdater interacts with this, but I hope that's enough to point the investigation.<span class="line"><!---->I'm not sure how the lifetime of ComponentUpdater interacts with this, but I hope that's enough to point the investigation.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        </div>

        CUS is destroyed postthreadstop during browser shutdown.<span class="line"><!---->CUS is destroyed postthreadstop during browser shutdown.<!----></span><br>It looks like the SwReporterOnDemandFetcher destructor runs on each call to RequestUserInitiatedScan (which I don't think can happen post thread stop) or on destruction of ChromeCleanerControllerImpl (which I think never happens outside of tests).<span class="line"><!---->It looks like the SwReporterOnDemandFetcher destructor runs on each call to RequestUserInitiatedScan (which I don't think can happen post thread stop) or on destruction of ChromeCleanerControllerImpl (which I think never happens outside of tests).<!----></span><br><br>Joe, is that right?<span class="line"><!---->Joe, is that right?<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>

          Components:<strong><!---->Components:</strong>
          
          Services>Safebrowsing>ChromeCleanup
          
          <br>
        
        
      <div class="issue-diff">
        <!---->
          <strong><!---->Components:</strong>
          
          Services&gt;Safebrowsing&gt;ChromeCleanup
          
          <br>
        <!---->
        
      </div><br>
    
        
      
        You can create a SwReporterOnDemandFetcher by going to chrome://settings/cleanup and clicking the "Find" button. (Requires a Google branded Chrome build.) I believe it's NOT created if the component updater happens to already by downloading a copy of the SwReporter component.<span class="line"><!---->You can create a SwReporterOnDemandFetcher by going to chrome://settings/cleanup and clicking the "Find" button. (Requires a Google branded Chrome build.) I believe it's NOT created if the component updater happens to already by downloading a copy of the SwReporter component.<!----></span><br><br>So this should only happen if UI is displayed. Possibly it could be triggered at an odd time by automation (eg. selenium). Untrusted web pages and extensions shouldn't be able to interact with chrome://settings so I think this would be low security impact.<span class="line"><!---->So this should only happen if UI is displayed. Possibly it could be triggered at an odd time by automation (eg. selenium). Untrusted web pages and extensions shouldn't be able to interact with chrome://settings so I think this would be low security impact.<!----></span><br><br>I'm not sure how the lifetime of ComponentUpdater interacts with this, but I hope that's enough to point the investigation.<span class="line"><!---->I'm not sure how the lifetime of ComponentUpdater interacts with this, but I hope that's enough to point the investigation.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>

        mr-launch-overview {
          max-width: 100%;
          display: flex;

        }

          margin-bottom: 0.75em;

           issue<h3 class="medium-heading"><!----> issue</h3>
          
            Target project:<label for="targetProjectInput">Target project:</label>
            
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              
      
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }

        for LitElement.

 runOnLoad(function() {
 if (typeof(ClientLogger) === "function") {
 let cl = new ClientLogger("issues");
 if (cl.started("new-issue")) {
 cl.logEnd("new-issue", null, 120 * 1000);
 }
 if (cl.started("issue-search")) {
 cl.logEnd("issue-search");
 }
 }
 });
<script type="text/javascript" nonce="">
 runOnLoad(function() {
 if (typeof(ClientLogger) === "function") {
 let cl = new ClientLogger("issues");
 if (cl.started("new-issue")) {
 cl.logEnd("new-issue", null, 120 * 1000);
 }
 if (cl.started("issue-search")) {
 cl.logEnd("issue-search");
 }
 }
 });
</script>
